Message.Title: Carl Icahn was never serious, Exhibits
Message.Msg: The Committee was right to point out Carl's phony bid. He had tried the same tactic numerous times before: Carl Icahn has tried — or “tried” — to buy a bunch of companies in the last year or so. Remember that Dynegy bid? Or his offer to take over Clorox? Or his $1.91 billion acquisition lob at Mentor Graphics? All failed, revoked or never serious in the first place. And now we can add another yanked deal to his list. January 11, 2012, 9:03 AM Carl Icahn Says, Never Mind Icahn today said he is withdrawing a roughly $1.7 billion hostile takeover offer for scrap-metal company Commercial Metals And there were others: Oshkosh Board Unanimously Rejects Icahn’s $3 Billion Bid Updated Oct 26, 2012 Icahn Makes Offer to Acquire Oshkosh in $3 Billion Deal Updated Oct 11, 2012

Topic.Title: Carl Icahn was never serious, Exhibits

Message.Msg: What's different this time is that Icahn is not trying to buy Dell. He's acting as an activist shareholder, telling Dell to borrow money and sell some assets and use their cash to give money back to shareholders.

Message.Title: Who gets a ballot?
Message.Msg: With only 500 shares, I have not gotten any shareholder materials recently. I have received communications in the past. Does one need to have a certain number of shares before DELL sends shareholder materials out?

Topic.Title: Who gets a ballot?

Message.Msg: no, against SEC rule on fair disclosure. However, your brokerage may have the dell material via electronic delivery instead of snail mail. However, big share holders may get calls from activist groups to solicit votes for or against.

Topic.Title: Who gets a ballot?

Message.Msg: The other big factor is, you had to be a shareholder of record on June 4th 2013 and still own those shares to be able to vote!

Topic.Title: Is there a way to watch or listen to the meeting today?

Message.Title: Michael Dell Attempts LOOTING of Shareholders - My Opinion
Message.Msg: it's obvious Michael Dell is trying to steal the company from shareholders for cheap! you think he's running a charity? he wants to buy DELL on the cheap and then bring it public again in a few years and DOUBLE his fortune. this is the reward the BOD wants to give him for destroying shareholder value over the last 10+ years!!! Michael Dell and his compatriots were purposely talking down the stock at every chance they got well before his buyout was announced! are you that blind to not see the conflict of interest and the cause and effect here? Michael and the BOD control the information flow and they purposely have been painting a bad picture for investors. WHY? so he could buy the company for cheap! you ever buy a used car and negotiate? the first thing you do is walk around and point out all of the dings and flaws! but in this case the same BOD that was selling OUR (shareholders) car were the ones pointing out the flaws to beat down the price so Michael could get a sweetheart deal and buy the car for cheap! Michael was/is in a unique position to METHODICALLY PREMEDITATEDLY IN ADVANCE talk down the price and screw shareholders! for all i know - they manipulated earnings and margin numbers and forecasts as well! stranger things have happened in my 20 years of following Wall Street! One of the Dell directors (Laura Conigliaro) who was part of a four-person special committee that approved the buyout of the company at $13.65 a share is a former Goldman Sachs equity research analyst who had a $35 price target on Dell back in 2007. THE POINT IS this woman has no clue how to value anything! WHY SHOULD I TRUST HER OPINION FOR $13.65 WHEN I COULDN'T TRUST HER AT $35 6 YEARS AGO??????? LIKE CARL SAID - SHE IS DRINKING THE KOOL-AID THAT DELL GIVES HER!!! WHY SHOULD I BELIEVE THIS WOMAN NOW WHEN SHE TELLS ME DELL IS WORTH $13.65?????? i don't have/never had a specific target for DELL because that's not what i do. nor do i believe anything any analyst has say.
